intro: Neoblakea venezuelensis, commonly known as the Venezuelan neoblakea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas at moderate elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
